condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, communities in priority areas are aware of good practices in education, health, nutrition, protection, water, hygiene and sanitation, as well as the interest of using basic social services and promoting inter and intra community tolerance.

description.narrative: With UNICEF support, Mali has adopted, validated and started implementing the National Communication for Development Policy (PNCD). Communication for Development (C4D) has contributed to the achievements of results at sectoral level to generate/increase demand for services aiming to improve their use. In 2019, 47,239 young people (19,105 girls) from 5 regions have completed the skills development programme (vs a 49,000 target) and 61,000 U reporters (vs. 100.000 target) were enrolled. 2,500 young people and 900 women ambassadors conducted door-to-door awareness on peace and social reconciliation and the G5 Sahel Strategy including on the Peace accord in Tombouctou and Mopti areas. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020
